If, at time \\( t_1 < T \\), an intervention by another transformation \\( z(t) = e^{-it}w \\) is applied, will the state \\( w(T) \\) at time T depend only on A, ignoring the initial and intervening transformations?
Explanation: The state \\( w(T) \\) at time T is influenced by both the initial transformation and the intervening transformation. Each exponential function represents a distinct phase rotation in the complex plane, which will influence the trajectory and endpoint depending on their specific interactions with the matrix A and each other.
